HelpXML.Title: MMmult
HelpXML.Purpose: MMmult computes MM estimators in multivariate analysis with auxiliary S-scale

Item.Name: Y
Item.LongDesc: n x v data matrix; n observations and v variables. Rows of Y represent observations, and columns represent variables. Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values will automatically be excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: InitialEst
Item.LongDesc: InitialEst must contain the following fields: InitialEst.loc0 = 1 x v vector (estimate of the centroid) InitialEst.shape0 = v x v matrix (estimate of the shape matrix) InitialEst.auxscale = scalar (estimate of the scale parameter). If InitialEst is empty (default) program uses S estimators. In this last case it is possible to specify the options given in function Smult.

ItemCell.Description: 1 x v vector (estimate of the centroid)
v x v matrix (estimate of the shape matrix)
scalar (estimate of the scale parameter). If InitialEst is empty (default) program uses S estimators. In this last case it is possible to specify the options given in function Smult.

Item.Name: Soptions
Item.ShortDesc: options if initial estimator is S and InitialEst is empty.
Item.TypeInd: Srhofunc,Snsamp,Srefsteps, Sreftol, Srefstepsbestr, Sreftolbestr, Sminsctol, Sbestr.
Item.LongDesc: See function Smult.m for more details on these options. It is necessary to add to the S options the letter S at the beginning. For example, if you want to use the optimal rho function the supplied option is 'Srhofunc','optimal'. For example, if you want to use 3000 subsets, the supplied option is 'Snsamp',3000

Item.Name: Sbdp
Item.LongDesc: It measures the fraction of outliers the algorithm should resist. In this case any value greater than 0 but smaller or equal than 0.5 will do fine (default=0.5). Note that given bdp nominal efficiency is automatically determined.

Item.Name: Sbestr
Item.LongDesc: Scalar defining number of "best betas" to remember from the subsamples. These will be later iterated until convergence (default=5)

Item.Name: Sminsctol
Item.ShortDesc: tolerance for the iterative procedure for finding the minimum value of the scale.
Item.LongDesc: Value of tolerance for the iterative procedure for finding the minimum value of the scale for each subset and each of the best subsets (It is used by subroutine minscale.m) The default value is 1e-7;

Item.Name: Snsamp
Item.ShortDesc: Number of subsamples which will be extracted to find the robust estimator.
Item.LongDesc: If nsamp=0 all subsets will be extracted. They will be (n choose p). If the number of all possible subset is <1000 the default is to extract all subsets otherwise just 1000.

Item.Name: Srefsteps
Item.LongDesc: Number of refining iterationsin each subsample (default = 3). refsteps = 0 means "raw-subsampling" without iterations.

Item.Name: Sreftol
Item.TypeInd: Default value of tolerance for the refining steps.

Item.Name: Srefstepsbestr
Item.ShortDesc: number of refining iterations for each best subset.
Item.LongDesc: Scalar defining number of refining iterations for each best subset (default = 50).

Item.Name: Sreftolbestr
Item.LongDesc: Tolerance for the refining steps for each of the best subsets The default value is 1e-8;

Item.Name: eff
Item.LongDesc: Scalar defining nominal efficiency (i.e. a number between 0.5 and 0.99). The default value is 0.95 Asymptotic nominal efficiency is: $(\int \psi' d\Phi)^2 / (\psi^2 d\Phi)$

Item.Name: effshape
Item.LongDesc: If effshape=1 efficiency refers to shape efficiency else (default) efficiency refers to location

Item.Name: refsteps
Item.LongDesc: Scalar defining maximum number of iterations in the MM loop. Default value is 100.

Item.Name: tol
Item.LongDesc: Scalar controlling tolerance in the MM loop. Default value is 1e-7

Item.Name: conflev
Item.ShortDesc: Confidence level which is used to declare units as outliers.
Item.LongDesc: Usually conflev=0.95, 0.975 0.99 (individual alpha) or 1-0.05/n, 1-0.025/n, 1-0.01/n (simultaneous alpha). Default value is 0.975

Item.Name: plots
Item.LongDesc: If plots is a structure or scalar equal to 1, generates: (1) a plot of Mahalanobis distances against index number. The confidence level used to draw the confidence bands for the MD is given by the input option conflev. If conflev is not specified a nominal 0.975 confidence interval will be used. (2) a scatter plot matrix with the outliers highlighted. If plots is a structure it may contain the following fields plots.labeladd = if this option is '1', the outliers in the spm are labelled with their unit row index. The default value is labeladd='', i.e. no label is added. plots.nameY = cell array of strings containing the labels of the variables. As default value, the labels which are added are Y1, ...Yv.

ItemCell.Description: if this option is '1', the outliers in the spm are labelled with their unit row index. The default value is labeladd='', i.e. no label is added.
cell array of strings containing the labels of the variables. As default value, the labels which are added are Y1, ...Yv.

Item.Name: nocheck
Item.LongDesc: If nocheck is equal to 1 no check is performed on matrix Y. As default nocheck=0.

Item.Name: ysave
Item.ShortDesc: input data matrix Y is saved into the output structure out.
Item.LongDesc: Scalar that is set to 1 to request that the data matrix Y is saved into the output structure out. This feature is meant at simplifying the use of function malindexplot. Default is 0, i.e. no saving is done.

ItemCell.Description: 1 x v vector with MM estimate of location
v x v matrix with MM estimate of the shape matrix
v x v matrix with MM estimate of the covariance matrix Remark: covariance = auxscale^2 * shape
n x 1 vector. Weights assigned to each observation
1 x k vectors containing the outliers which have been found
1 x v vector with S estimate of location
v x v matrix with S estimate of the shape matrix
v x v matrix with S estimate of the covariance matrix
scalar, S estimate of the scale
Data matrix Y. The field is present if option ysave is set to 1.
scalar, confidence level which has been used
n x 1 vector containing robust Mahalanobis distances

Item.Name: varargout
Item.TypeInd: Indices of the subsamples extracted for computing the estimate (the so called elemental sets).

HelpXML.Acknowledgements: This function follows the lines of MATLAB/R code developed during the years by many authors. For more details see http://www.econ.kuleuven.be/public/NDBAE06/programs/ and the R library robustbase http://robustbase.r-forge.r-project.org/ The core of these routines, e.g. the resampling approach, however, has been completely redesigned, with considerable increase of the computational performance.

References.Item: Maronna, R.A., Martin D. and Yohai V.J. (2006),Robust Statistics, Theory and Methods, Wiley,New York.
